definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: At the same time, another tragicomedy is played in the Imperial Palace of Tand Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，唐朝皇宫望仙台上，也上演着一幕悲喜剧。

sentences.english: In many areas, this tragicomedy staged continuously.
sentences.chinese: 在许多地区，这一悲喜剧不断上演。
这是一部音乐记录悲喜剧。

sentences.english: He is a tragicomic character trapped in a maze of misrepresentations, and also a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 他是个陷入误解迷宫的悲喜剧角色，也是个混蛋。

sentences.english: Last week, the China concept stocks in the Nasdaq staged a " Tragicomedy . " U.
sentences.chinese: 上周，中国概念股在纳斯达克上演了一出“悲喜剧”。

sentences.english: In this thesis, the author mainly introduces the artistic style of Ryazanov's combination of tragedy and comedy.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要介绍梁赞诺夫的悲喜剧作品的艺术风格。

sentences.english: The extraordinary tragicomedy of race, class and manners.
sentences.chinese: 种族，阶级和举止非凡的悲喜剧。

sentences.english: The development of tragicomedy corresponds to the change of social value.
sentences.chinese: 中西悲喜剧的兴衰，与社会价值的变化直接相关。

sentences.english: A lot of time to weave the story of the tragicomedy staged numerous.
sentences.chinese: 时间编织了许多的故事，上演了无数的悲喜剧。

sentences.english: Would they have us wait till the whole tragicomedy of 1827 has been acted over again;
sentences.chinese: 难道他们要我们等到1827年的整个悲喜剧重演吗？
这构成女作家一生的悲喜剧。

sentences.english: This actually is a tragicomedy's finesse.
sentences.chinese: 这其实就是一种悲喜剧的手法。

definition: joys and sorrows/partings and reunions/the vicissitudes of life
